intro: Gloriosa simplex, commonly known as the flame flower, is a striking tropical plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its long, spiral-shaped leaves and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from yellow to red. The plant belongs to the family Colocasiaceae and is known for its unique, curling petals that resemble a flame. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
